paramInformation.label: Overcurrent Protection
paramInformation.description: Smart plug keep detecting the load power, once the ac current exceeds 16.5a for more than 5s, smart plug's relay will turn off

paramInformation.label: Notification When Load Status Change
paramInformation.description: Smart plug can send notifications to association device (group lifeline) when state of smart plug’s load change

options.label: Send basic report only when load condition is not changed by Z-Wave command

paramInformation.label: Indicator Modes
paramInformation.description: After smart plug being included into a Z-Wave network, the RGB LED indicator will indicator the situation of load

options.label: The smart plug will work in power indication mode
The smart plug will work in power indication mode for 5 seconds, when the state of smart plug’s load changed. RGB LED indicator will turn off if there is no more switch action in 5 seconds

paramInformation.label: Threshold of Change in Wattage
paramInformation.description: Power threshold to be interpreted, when the change value of load power exceeds the setting threshold, the smart plug will send meter report to associated device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Threshold of Change in Wattage Percentage
paramInformation.description: Power percentage threshold to be interpreted, when change value of the load power exceeds the setting threshold, the smart plug will send meter report to associated device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Intervals of Sending Meter Report (for Wattage)
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending meter report(in term of wattage) to associated device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Intervals of Sending Meter Report (for Kwh)
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending meter report(in term of kwh) to associated device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Intervals of Sending Meter Report (for Voltage)
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending meter report(in term of voltage) to associated device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Intervals of Sending Meter Report (for Current)
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending meter report(in term of current) to associated device (group lifeline)

metadata.inclusion:
1) Connect the power supply.
2) Set the Z-Wave network main controller into inclusion mode (see Z-Wave network controller operating manual).
3) Triple click the Z-button or power up the device , RGB LED indicator should blink fast in blue.
4) Smart Plug should be recognized and included into the Z-Wave network.
metadata.exclusion:
1) Insert the Plug into a socket.
2) Set the Z-Wave network controller into the exclusion mode (see Z-Wave controller operating manual).
3) Triple click the Z button.
4) RGB LED indicator will blink orange till the removing process is completed, than the indicator will keep orange for 3 seconds.
metadata.reset:
1) Insert the Plug into a socket,
2) Press and hold the Z button for more than 20 seconds,
3) If holding time more than 20seconds, the RGB LED indicator will keep yellow for 2 seconds, which means resetting is complete. 
 Use this procedure only in the event that the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable.
